[The Ministry of Public Security discussed to solve the problem that 60% of the 13 million black households are super-born people] There are about 13 million people in China who do not have household registration, which is commonly known as "black households". More than 60% of these black households are super-birth workers. Because they have no household registration, most of them have no social security and lose their normal work, life and education opportunities. This also restricts the flow of population, increases social instability and exacerbates social inequality. O Web link

[Dear, throw away your mobile phone while sleeping] In the past decade, the number of patients with glioma has increased significantly. Glioma is the most common brain tumor with a high rate of death and disability. Its high incidence is related to the excessive use of electronic products. Carrying mobile phones close to the body, often cooking phone porridge, and putting mobile phones on the pillow while sleeping will lead to the accumulation of radiation in the body and make the body self-repairing system "tired". Children's scalp and skull are thinner and more sensitive to radiation. (City Express)

[2 simple methods: detect whether there is gutter oil] Method 1: put a peeled garlic (garlic seed) when frying vegetables. Garlic is the most sensitive to aflatoxin. [Don't be fooled! These eight kinds of honey don't exist at all] According to the new national standard for honey, honey is a pure natural substance. Honeysuckle honey, rose honey, snow lotus honey, peach blossom honey... these eight kinds of honey do not exist at all! Learn to stamp and distinguish. Don't buy these honey next time! I just learned a knowledge to share with you: how to judge whether your toothpaste is healthy. There is a color block at the end of each toothpaste bag. [Who turned Vladivostok into Vladivostok] In 1856, China and Russia signed the Aihui Treaty, and Vladivostok was "jointly controlled". In 1860, China and Russia signed the Beijing Treaty, and Vladivostok became the territory of Russia, and was forced to change its name. The Sino-Soviet Union Treaty in 1945 agreed that China would take back Haisanwei 50 years later. On July 16, 2001, China and Russia signed the Sino-Russian Treaty of Good-neighbourly Friendship and Cooperation, and China confirmed that it would give up its territorial sovereignty, which is now owned by Russia.

[Chinese cats are luckier than Chinese dogs] Article 2 of the Measures for the Administration of New Resource Food, which was implemented at the end of 2007, defines new resource food. Cats belong to the first item of the definition, "animals without eating habits in China", and do not belong to the category of livestock and poultry. The definition of livestock and poultry in the Animal Husbandry Law is the animals listed in the livestock and poultry resources catalogue, and cats are not included. When will dogs also enjoy this national treatment? China hates dogs in the market.

Vladivostok was called Yongming City in the Yuan Dynasty. The unequal Sino-Russian Aihui Treaty in 1858 led the Tsarist Russia to occupy Vladivostok, an important port of China, in June 1860 In February 1945, the "Sino-Soviet Friendship and Alliance Treaty" was signed, and the representatives of the National Government proposed to reclaim the sovereignty of Dalian, Vladivostok and the Kayin Islands. The Soviet Union agreed that China should take back the Dalian, Lushun and Manchurian railways, and reached an agreement to take back Vladivostok 50 years later. According to about 1996, China should return to Vladivostok

[An ammonia leakage of 300 kg occurred in a chemical plant in Pingdingshan, Henan Province, and 20 people were injured] At about 6:30 this morning, the transmission pipeline of the synthetic ammonia tower in the chemical plant of Zhonghong Coal Chemical Company in Shilong District, Pingdingshan, Henan Province burst, and the synthetic ammonia leakage occurred, with the leakage amount of about 300 kg. The Kuomintang government of that year strongly advocated the recovery of Vladivostok. On the eve of the victory of the War of Resistance in February 1945, when the "Sino-Soviet Friendship and Alliance Treaty" was signed with the Soviet Union, the Soviet Union agreed that China would recover the sovereignty of Vladivostok 50 years later, that is, in 1996, China would recover Vladivostok. However, on July 16, 2001, China and Russia signed the Sino-Russian Treaty of Good-neighbourly Friendship and Cooperation in the Kremlin in Moscow, recognizing that Vladivostok and the neighboring Far East will no longer be China's territory "forever".
